title: Data requests block each other, and some API requests, due to casefs lock contention

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.14.0
milestone.description:
This release adds configurable device and folder defaults.

The output format of the [/rest/db/browse endpoint](https://docs.syncthing.net/rest/db-browse-get.html) has changed.

body:
When there are many incoming requests (because there are many folders and/or devices), API requests like /rest/db/status become very slow for no obvious reason. (No CPU, memory or I/O bottle necks to see.) Analysis shows thousands of routines with the following stack:

```
goroutine 16855 [semacquire, 27 minutes]:
sync.runtime_SemacquireMutex(0x1ed7fec, 0xc000124b00, 0x1)
        runtime/sema.go:71 +0x4e
sync.(*Mutex).lockSlow(0x1ed7fe8)
        sync/mutex.go:138 +0x10f
sync.(*Mutex).Lock(...)
        sync/mutex.go:81
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs.(*caseFilesystemRegistry).get(0x1ed7fe0, 0x18cf520, 0xc00def1380, 0x0)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/casefs.go:56 +0x35c
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs.NewCaseFilesystem(...)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/casefs.go:101
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/config.FolderConfiguration.Filesystem(0xc00030ada0, 0x12, 0xc00030ade0, 0x19, 0x0, 0xc000318400, 0xa, 0x1, 0xc00195a000, 0x3c, ...)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/config/folderconfiguration.go:68 +0xc5
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model.(*model).Request(0xc00186c000, 0x17d5caa35f67f90d, 0xca36b04081d3069e, 0x643bd410871dbe8e, 0x1ded034089f1740e, 0xc00b417ce0, 0x12, 0xc00b417d60, 0x1b, 0x2000000000000, ...)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/model/model.go:1740 +0xc78
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol.nativeModel.Request(0x295b4de66d8, 0xc00186c000, 0x17d5caa35f67f90d, 0xca36b04081d3069e, 0x643bd410871dbe8e, 0x1ded034089f1740e, 0xc00b417ce0, 0x12, 0xc00b417d00, 0x1b, ...)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol/nativemodel_windows.go:36 +0x282
github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol.(*rawConnection).handleRequest(0xc0170c53b0, 0x14f, 0xc00b417ce0, 0x12, 0xc00b417d00, 0x1b, 0x920000, 0x20000, 0xc00b417d20, 0x20, ...)
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol/protocol.go:664 +0x12e
created by github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol.(*rawConnection).dispatcherLoop
        github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/protocol/protocol.go:467 +0x2c5
```

The DB status API call ends up in this "pool" of waiting goroutines because it calls the folder summary service which looks at ignore patterns which creates a filesystem which ends up in the above. As you can see from the semacquire time it can take quite a while to get served (this isn't an extreme example; "hours" were mentioned).
